intro: Actinophlebia obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved actinophlebia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, wiry stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often growing in open, sunny areas. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
